content:
• Wednesday, May 30, 2018
  • P

    Pandora matches rivals with family subscription

    • Pandora's (NYSE:P) latest subscription service is set to help it compete against tough rivals in Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) and Spotify (NYSE:SPOT), its CEO says.
    • Subscriptions are "the fastest growing part of our business," Roger Lynch tells CNBC in discussing the rollout of the Pandora Premium Family plan.
    • That move catches the company up somewhat to existing family sub offerings from competitors, after losing a number of users to Apple and Spotify.
    • The new plan lets up to six family members share music for $14.99/month, and Lynch says it has a "twist" in a feature called "Our Soundtrack."
    • Pandora shares gained 3% during the market session; they're down 2.8% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:41 PM | 22 Comments
  • NGL

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (05/30/2018)

    • Top gainers: NGL +13.6%. TLYS +13.0%. KEYS +4.7%. WPG +2.6%. AGLE +1.8%.
    • Top Losers: CRSP -19.0%. EDIT -5.5%.  CHMI -5.1%. BOX -3.9%. RGNX -2.9%.

  • WIN

    Windstream launches consent solicitation on senior secured credit

    • Windstream Holdings (NASDAQ:WIN) has confirmed that subsidiaries Windstream Services and Windstream Finance Corp. are starting a consent solicitation to amend the company's 8.625% senior first-lien notes due 2025, with an eye toward amending its senior secured credit facility.
    • As of today, the outstanding principal on those notes was about $600M.
    • The purpose is to allow for indebtedness on a junior lien basis and for corresponding junior lien intercreditor agreements.
    • Shares closed down 10.2% today after earlier reports that it would be seeking a credit amendment. They're flat on heavy after-hours volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM | 16 Comments
  • CRSP

    CRISPR Therapeutics down 20% after hours on IND hold for sickle cell candidate CTX001

    • CRISPR Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CRSP) slumps 20% after hours on robust volume in response to its disclosure that the FDA has placed a clinical hold on its IND for sickle cell disease (SCD) gene therapy candidate CTX001. The suspension will be in effect pending the resolution of certain questions related to the application.
    • Once approved, a U.S.-based Phase 1/2 study in adult SCD patients will commence. A Phase 1/2 study in adults with transfusion-dependent beta-thalassemia should start in H2 in Europe.
    • The company is co-developing the therapy with collaboration partner Vertex Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:VRTX).
    • SCD-related tickers: (NASDAQ:GBT)(NASDAQ:BLUE)(NASDAQ:SNY)(NASDAQ:SGMO)(NASDAQ:IRWD)
    • Previously: CRISPR Therapeutics and Vertex team up to advance and commercialize lead gene editing candidate for blood disorders (Dec. 12, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM | 68 Comments
  • SMTC

    Semtech -0.9% on Q1 beats, in-line guidance

    • Semtech (NASDAQ:SMTC) drops 0.9% aftermarket on Q1 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 2% Y/Y revenue growth. In-line Q2 guidance has revenue of $155M to $167M (consensus: $160.32M) and EPS from $0.50 to $0.58 (consensus: $0.53).
    • Capital allocation: Board approves an additional $250M share repurchase under the existing program, bringing the total to $272M. 
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM Eastern with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.       
    • Previously: Semtech beats by $0.01, beats on revenue (May 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM

    Keysight Technologies +1.8% on Q2 revenue beat, upside rev. guide

    • Keysight Technologies (NYSE:KEYS) gains 1.8% aftermarket on Q2 results that met EPS estimates but beat on revenue with a 32% Y/Y revenue growth. Q3 guidance has upside revenue from $942M to $972M (consensus: $916.44M) and in-line EPS from $0.72 to $0.82 (consensus: $0.74).  
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 4:30 PM Eastern with a webcast available here.

  • PVH

    PVH lifts full-year profit guidance

    • PVH (NYSE:PVH) reports sales rose 10% in FQ1 on a constant currency basis as both the Calvin Klein and Tommy Hilfiger brands saw momentum.
    • Revenue was up 12% for the CK business on a constant currency basis and 11% for the Tommy Hilfiger brand.
    • The company lifts guidance after knocking out the solid quarter, now seeing full-year revenue growth of 6% and full-year EPS of $9.05 to $9.15 vs. $9.00 to $9.10 prior and $9.12 consensus.
    • PVH +0.32% AH to $156.00.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • T

    AT&T's Stephenson: Sprint/T-Mobile might succeed despite 'uphill battle'

    • AT&T (NYSE:T) chief Randall Stephenson says a proposed combination of Sprint (NYSE:S) with T-Mobile (NASDAQ:TMUS) might succeed where he failed -- in his own bid to acquire T-Mobile.
    • That doesn't mean the wireless merger is anything close to an assured deal, he said at Code Conference, noting things have changed since 2011.
    • It will probably get a different review than our deal," he said. "Power to them if they get it done.
    • Adding to the hurdles is the fact that Sprint and T-Mobile would be horizontal competitors combining; AT&T has it hands full as it awaits a judge's decision on whether or how it can proceed with a vertical takeover of Time Warner.
    • Today: S +1.8%; TMUS -0.5%; T +0.7%; TWX +0.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 28 Comments
  • VCEL

    Vericel readies stock offering; shares down 4% after hours

    • Vericel (NASDAQ:VCEL) is down 4% after hours on the heels of its announced public offering of 3.75M shares of common stock. Underwriters over-allotment is an additional 562.5K shares. Price and terms have yet to be released.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM | 35 Comments
  • NGL

    NGL Energy Partners to sell remaining propane business for $900M

    • NGL Energy Partners (NYSE:NGL) +4.6% after-hours on news it agrees to sell its remaining retail propane business to Superior Plus Corp. for $900M, as it decides to focus on its water solutions and crude logistics businesses.
    • NGL says the recent divestitures of all retail propane assets generated more than $1.1B of gross cash proceeds, which equates to a 2018 EBITDA multiple exceeding 10x.
    • NGL also says the sale will significantly reduce the seasonality and weather-dependency of its earnings and lower annual maintenance capex by ~$10M.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 11 Comments
  • GLPG

    Gilead and Galapagos' filgotinib successful in mid-stage psoriatic arthritis study

    • Galapagos NV (NASDAQ:GLPG) and collaboration partner Gilead Sciences (NASDAQ:GILD) announce positive results from a Phase 2 clinical trial, EQUATOR, evaluating JAK1 inhibitor filgotinib in adult patients with moderate-to-severe psoriatic arthritis (PA).
    • The study met the primary endpoint of a statistically significant proportion of patients achieving at least a 20% improvement (ARC20) in signs and symptoms of PA at week 16. Specifically, 80% of patients in the treatment group achieved ARC20 versus 33% for placebo (p<0.001).
    • ARC50 (50% improvement in PA symptoms) and ARC70 scores also demonstrated the superiority of filgotinib, 48% vs. 15% (p<0.001) and 23% vs. 6% (p<0.01), respectively.
    • No new safety signals were observed. There was one death in the filgotinib group due to pneumonia. Another participant developed herpes zoster (shingles).
    • Complete results will be submitted for presentation at a future medical conference.
    • Separately, a Phase 2b/3 study, SELECTION, evaluating filgotinib in ulcerative colitis will proceed into Phase 3 as planned. The action triggers a $15M milestone payment to Galapagos from Gilead.
    • The companies are co-developing and co-commercializing filgotinib under a 2015 agreement.
    • Gilead is down a fraction after hours while Galapagos is unchanged.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 20 Comments
  • BOX

    Box -3.2% on Q1 beats, mixed Q2 guidance

    • Box (NYSE:BOX) drops 3.2% aftermarket on Q1 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 20% Y/Y revenue growth. Mixed Q2 guidance has in-line revenue from $146M to $147M (consensus: $146.24M) and downside EPS from -$0.06 to -$0.05 (-$0.07).
    • In-line FY19 guidance has revenue from $603M to $608M (consensus: $605.69M; was: $602M to $608M) and EPS from -$0.19 to -$0.16 (consensus: -$0.19). 
    • Key metrics: Billings, $116.7M (+17%); cash flow from operations, $18.4M (+$9.9M); FCF, $7.3M (+$3.2M).   
    • New board member: Sue Barsamian, EVP, Chief Sales and Marketing Officer, with the appointment effective immediately. 
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM Eastern with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.    
    • Previously: Box beats by $0.01, beats on revenue (May 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 11 Comments
  • TLYS

    Calendar friendly to Tilly's guidance

    • Tilly's (NYSE:TLYS) soars after posting guidance way ahead of expectations for FQ2.
    • The retailer sees Q2 revenue of $153M to $157M vs. $142M consensus and EPS of $0.24 to $0.28 vs. $0.14 consensus.
    • Shares of Tilly's are up 16% in AH trading, but investors should be careful. Management says that the calendar shift that impacted Q2 guidance in a positive way will come around to ding Q3.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • CARS

    Cars.com spikes on sale talk

    • Cars.com (CARS +8.9%) made a late day jump after the New York Post reported that the company hired JPMorgan to advise it on a potential sale.
    • Earlier this month, activist investor Starboard Capital landed two nominees to the board at Cars.com. Sources say Starboard is looking for $40 a share in a sale scenario.
    • Apax Partners and Cox Communications are being talked about as potential bidders for the Cars.com property.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 6 Comments

  • SC

    Santander Consumer stock descent is overdone," says BTIG analyst

    • Santander Consumer USA (NYSE:SC), down 6.3% in late trading, pared an earlier loss of more than 9% today after Bloomberg reported that Fiat Chrysler (NYSE:FCAU) is likely to set up its own U.S. finance unit, an action that would "introduce and element of uncertainty into the SC story," BTIG analyst Mark Palmer wrote in a note.
    • Still, Palmer sees the market reaction as "overdone" and says investors should instead focus on SC's excess capital and the potential for its parent to buy out the remaining shares that it doesn't already own.
    • He reiterates his "buy" recommendation on price target of $21.
    • The 10-year financing agreement with Fiat Chrysler has been disappointing to both parties. The arrangement's targeted penetration rate as of April 30 was 65%, while SC's actual penetration rate for Chrysler Capital during Q118 was 28%, Palmer says.
    • If Fiat Chrysler's action does lead to lower volume for SC, the company could be willing to accept a smaller balance sheet and focus on share buybacks, which " could result in more upside for shareholders within a shorter period of time," Palmer notes.
    • Previously: Santander Consumer down nearly 10% on Fiat revamp (May 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • GOGO

    Director Townsend snapping up Gogo shares amid decline

    • Shares in Gogo (GOGO -5.7%) have hit their all-time low today after a price-target slashing from Morgan Stanley, though one director is taking advantage of a post-earnings decline this week.
    • In filings over the past 24 hours, Charles Townsend has disclosed that he purchased a combined 359,267 shares last Thursday and Friday (for just under a combined $1.79M), for direct holding by PAC LLC.
    • Yesterday, he acquired another 140,733 shares for PAC LLC for just under $740,000.
    • Townsend owns another 554,267 shares through a trust. PAC LLC holds 2,120,344 shares after the transactions.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 12 Comments
  • ATI

    Allegheny Tech +5% as Goldman upgrades; AK Steel up despite Sell rating

    • Allegheny Technologies (ATI +4.7%) enjoys strong gains after Goldman Sachs analyst Matthew Korn upgrades shares to Neutral from Sell with a $29 price target, raised from $26, citing the company's "consistency in a growing but technologically challenging market" as well as fair valuation.
    • AK Steel (AKS +3.7%) also is higher even as Goldman cuts shares to Sell, saying "unfavorable trends" in its realized prices are an ongoing overhang for the company and require more conservative margin projections.
    • Korn also rates Nucor (NUE +2.2%) and Steel Dynamics (STLD +2.8%) as Buys, saying the stocks "offer a clearer path toward growth and expanded profitability."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM | 4 Comments
  • ROLL

    RBC Bearings up 2% post Q4 results

    • RBC Bearings (ROLL +2.3%) reports Q4 revenue growth of 12.3% Y/Y to $179.9M.
    • Organic net sales growth of 13.5% in Q4 & 10.0% for full year 2018.
    • Segment net external sales: Plain bearings $81.9M (+12.8% Y/Y); Roller bearings $35.8M (+24.7% Y/Y); Ball bearings $19.1M (+15.8% Y/Y) & Engineered products $43.1M (+1.4% Y/Y).
    • Q1 overall margins: Adj. gross declined 70 bps to 38.8%; adj. operating declined 20 bps to 21.3% .
    • Backlog was $392.1M (+10.7% Y/Y).
    • CFO was $37.8M (+41.6% Y/Y); Capex of $7.4M (+13.8% Y/Y); Total debt $173.4M (-35.7% Y/Y) & Cash and short-term investments of $54.2M (+39.3% Y/Y).
    • Q1 Outlook: Net sales ~$171-174M, will result in a growth rate of ~4.3%-6.2% Y/Y & organic growth rate of ~6.3%-8.2% Y/Y.
    • Previously: RBC Bearings misses by $0.06, beats on revenue (May 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM

    BJ's Restaurants +6% on Guggenheim confidence

    • Shares of BJ's Restaurants (NASDAQ:BJRI) are up 6.15% after Guggenheim lifts its price target on the Buy-rated restaurant stock to $62 from $55.
    • The $62 PT matches the highest on the books of a Wall Street firm and is above the 52-week high on BJRI of $57.65.

  • CP

    CP Rail strike ends after reaching deal with conductors, engineers

    • Canadian Pacific Railway (CP +3.2%) says it reached tentative agreements with ~3K conductors and locomotive engineers, ending a strike hours after it began.
    • "This is a positive result for our TCRC employees and their families, the 12,000-strong CP family, our customers and the entire Canadian economy," says CP Rail President and CEO Keith Creel.
    • The company earlier reached a deal with ~360 signal workers.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM | 8 Comments
  • CVX

    Chevron shareholders turn aside climate, methane proposals

    • Chevron (CVX +3.3%) shareholders reject two non-binding but symbolically important shareholder resolutions related to climate change at the company’s annual meeting, but a measure calling for more action to cut methane emissions narrowly lost with 45% support.
    • The close call could prompt CVX to follow Exxon's move last year in implementing a methane management program and setting a reduction target.
    • Another more aggressive proposal calling for CVX to propose ways to reduce its production of fossil fuels received just 8% of shareholder votes.
    • CVX shares, like XOM, are surging today as crude oil prices spike following a report that OPEC and other top oil producing countries may leave current production curbs in place.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM | 10 Comments
  • MRKR

    TapImmune up 24%

    • Thinly traded nano cap TapImmune (TPIV +24.4%) is up on a 23x surge in volume. No particular news accounts for the action although the company is in need of additional capital.
    • At the end of March, it has $2.8M in cash while operations consumed ~$2.3M in Q1.
    • In late December 2017, it filed a prospectus for the potential resale of ~4.4M common shares by existing investors and ~6.5M shares issuable upon the exercise of warrants.

  • ORMP

    Oramed up 20% on U.S. patent for POD technology

    • Thinly traded micro cap Oramed Pharmaceuticals (ORMP +20.3%) is up on almost a 5x surge in volume, albeit on turnover of only 86K shares, in apparent response to its announcement of the issuance of a new U.S. patent covering methods and compositions for the oral administration of proteins. The patent provides additional protection for its POD technology used in its oral insulin.

  • DAKT

    Daktronics down 17% on Q4 earnings miss

    • Daktronics (DAKT -17.5%) reported Q4 net sales of $138.18M (-3.8% Y/Y) and total orders of $161.97M (-9.1% Y/Y).
    • Segment sales: Commercial $31.81M (-11% Y/Y), live events $44.9M (-21.1% Y/Y), high school park & recreation $18.03M (+30.4% Y/Y), transportation $13M (+0.7% Y/Y) and international $30.44M (+25.4% Y/Y).
    • Segment orders: Commercial $37.55M (+0.8% Y/Y), live events $55.79M (-33.9% Y/Y), high school park & recreation $26.85M (+19.2% Y/Y), transportation $12.43M (-24% Y/Y) and international $27.34M (+87.6% Y/Y).
    • Q4 Overall margins: gross declined by 187 bps to 21.6% and operating declined by 507 bps to -3.88%.
    • Q4 Expenses: Selling increased by 7.8% Y/Y to $17.2M, G&A increased by 6.4% Y/Y to $8.78M and product design & development increased by14.04% Y/Y to $9.23M.
    • Cash flow from operating activities was $30.4M as of 28 April 2018, down 29.6% Y/Y.
    • Backlog was $171M as of 28 April 2018, a decline of 18.71% Y/Y from $203M.
    • Previously: Daktronics misses by $0.14, misses on revenue (May 30)

    Windstream reportedly seeking credit amendment; shares -13.3%

    • Windstream Holdings (NASDAQ:WIN) is off 13.3% today following word that its Windstream Services unit is looking for an amendment to its credit facility.

    • Consents are due June 5, Bloomberg says.

  • Stocks retake lost ground, led by surging energy sector

    • Three hours before the close, the major averages are near session highs, the Dow and S&P 500 up 1.15%, and the Nasdaq 0.8%.

  • XOM

    Exxon shareholders nix proposal to split chairman, CEO roles

    • Exxon Mobil (XOM +3.6%) shareholders reject a proposal that would have split the roles of chairman and CEO, securing Darren Woods’s position alone at the top of the company hierarchy.
    • Shareholders also rejected a proposal that would have forced XOM to provide greater disclosure on its lobbying expenditures and approved a full slate of 10 nominees to the company’s board.
    • No climate-related proposals were on the agenda for this year’s meeting after a requirement for an annual carbon report was approved last year.
    • XOM shares are surging today on the heels of a spike in crude oil prices and an analyst upgrade from RBC Capital.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 5 Comments

    FDA OKs Pfizer's Xeljanz for ulcerative colitis; shares up 1%

    • The FDA approves Pfizer's (PFE +1%) XELJANZ ( tofacitinib) for the treatment of moderately-to-severely active ulcerative colitis.
    • The JAK inhibitor was approved in the U.S. in 2012 for rheumatoid arthritis and in 2017 for psoriatic arthritis.

    Blink Charging tracks higher

  • CMCO

    Columbus McKinnon jumps 8% on Q4 earnings, good guidance

    • Columbus McKinnon (CMCO +8.6%) reported Q4 net sales growth of 16.6% to $214.14M, US sales were $111.8M (+7.3% Y/Y) and Non-US sales were $102.3M (+28.7% Y/Y).
    • Q4 overall margins: Gross improved 740 bps to 34.8%, adj. gross improved by 240 bps to 34.6%, operating recovered by 930 bps to 7.6%, adj. operating improved 40 bps to 9.6% and Adj. EBITDA improved by 60 bps to 13.9%.
    • Q4 expenses margins: Selling increased by 120 bps to 12.9% and G&A decreased by 300 bps to 10.7%.
    • Backlog was $177.4M as of 31 March 2018, up 16% from $152.3M 31 as on December 2017.
    • Company paid $60.1M of debt, reducing the net debt to $363.3M as of 31 March 2018.
    • US shipping days were 63 in FY18 compared to 64 in FY17.
    • 1Q19 Outlook: Revenue growth between 7-9% (including benefits from forex); SG&A expenses of ~$48M, additional $0.5M in savings and ~$2M in restructuring cost.
    • FY19 Outlook: Capex $15-20M and tax rate 21-23%
    • Previously: Columbus McKinnon beats by $0.02, beats on revenue (May 30)

  • CEL

    Cellcom Israel down 4% post Q1 results

    • Cellcom Israel (CEL -4.1%) reports Q1 revenue decrease of 2.7% Y/Y to NIS 933M of which Cellular was NIS 630M (-9% Y/Y) & Fixed-line of NIS 343M (+8.5% Y/Y).
    • Cellular segment: Service revenues NIS 437M (-14.1% Y/Y); Equipment revenues NIS 193M (+5.5% Y/Y).
    • Fixed-line segment: Service revenues NIS 304M (+9% Y/Y); Equipment revenues NIS 39M (+5.4% Y/Y).
    • Q1 overall margins: Gross increased 356 bps to 31.5%; operating declined 217 bps to 4.8% & total EBIDTA declined 170 bps to 2.3% also, Cellular EBIDTA declined 520 bps to 17.8% & Fixed-line EBIDTA increased 650 bps to 19.8%.
    • Performance Indicators - Cellular: Cellular subscribers of 2,822 (+1.1% Y/Y); Churn Rate of 9.5% & Monthly cellular average revenue per user of NIS 51.8 (-14% Y/Y).
    • Performance Indicators - Fixed-line: Internet infrastructure field subscribers of 235 (+35.8% Y/Y) & TV field subscribers of 184 (+48.4% Y/Y).
    • "Cellcom Israel is the only Company in Israel that offers the quatro package. This advantage allows us to face the competition in the cellular segment, such that even as cellular prices decrease, we are successful in selling a complete communications package, and through this we increase total income per household." said Nir Sztern, CEO.
    • Previously: Cellcom Israel reports Q1 results (May 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • MDP

    Meredith +3.7% as Citi sees favorable risk/reward

  • ARAY

    Studies show value proposition of AccuRay's TomoTherapy; shares up 8%

    • Accuray (ARAY +8.1%) is up on below-average volume on the heels of its announcement of results from two studies demonstrating the benefits of TomoTherapy in total body irradiation (TBI), a procedure used to prepare leukemia and multiple myeloma patients for bone marrow transplant.
    • The first study, conducted in Toulouse, France, showed TBI delivered via the TomoTherapy platform facilitated the successful engraftment of 100% of patients (n=11) while avoiding radiation pneumonitis, inflammation of the lung that commonly occurs in patients undergoing radiation therapy.
    • The second study, conducted in Guangzhou, China, TomoTherapy was used to deliver TBI and a targeted dose of radiation to non-bone sites to improve outcomes in treatment-resistant leukemia patients. All patients achieved sustained full donor stem cell engraftment. At one year post procedure, the survival rate and disease-free survival rate were both 70.7%. No patient relapsed after a median follow-up period of 14.6 months.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM | 1 Comment
